pyLib.io package¶

Submodules¶

pyLib.io.argument module¶

argument.py

Easy arguments

pyLib.io.argument.getOnOffArgs(*args)¶

pyLib.io.fileio module¶

fileio.py

Useful functions for file io, especially dict of dict type. This type is heavily used for clustered training.

pyLib.io.fileio.assignModule(module, dct)¶

Assign values in dict to the module

pyLib.io.fileio.assignModuleByJson(module, fnm)¶

Change contents of a module by json file

pyLib.io.fileio.ddctParse(fnm, thekey=None)¶

Parse a file that is dict of dict. I wish this is faster than pickle

pyLib.io.fileio.ddctSave(fnm, arr, pklmode=False)¶

Save a dict of dict

pyLib.io.fileio.dumpJson(obj, fnm)¶
pyLib.io.fileio.getJson(fnm)¶

Parse a json file as a dict

pyLib.io.fileio.getLogPath(fnm, debug=False)¶

pyLib.io.printio module¶

printio.py

Control print

class pyLib.io.printio.Mute(mute=True, record=False)¶

Bases: list

Capture std.output.

getOutput()¶

pyLib.io.stringio module¶

stringio.py

Provides subroutines to extract numbers from string

pyLib.io.stringio.getNumber(string, mapfun=None)¶

Parse all numbers from a string

pyLib.io.stringio.joinNumber(arr, sign='_')¶

Join a list of numbers into a single string.
